results.content: Great course. Full of amazing information and the different ways Angular Animations can be implemented, which is one of the overwhelming facts of working with any JS framework, the rapid pace of change. However, I appreciate that Max goes above and beyond to show all the possibilities and leaving it up to us to decide if we want to stay up to date with the framework or keep our existing code base as is for a little longer. Thank you Max.

results.content:
One of the best courses I have ever followed. I study online since 2009, from many training provider. Maximilian is an excellent teacher, and can transfer that passion to his students.

Especially this course, covers really well the animations subject, and gives you all you need, to really go further in Angular animations and apply it professionally.

I have been working full time with Angular 2 for the past 8 months, and this course, has made a great addition.

Thank you Maximilian.
results.content_html:

Especially this course, covers really well the animations subject, and gives you all you need, to really go further in Angular animations and apply it professionally.

I have been working full time with Angular 2 for the past 8 months, and this course, has made a great addition.

Thank you Maximilian.

results.content:
I love my smartphone so i knew my  apps where missing something. 
I loved how each module of this course build up on each other. The examples are practical and The instructor is available to answer questions or help with problems that you might run into.  THis course took me about a week and I was able to go from a basic app to adding parent child route transitions along with staggered lists into my app and understand things to watch out for.  Super excited im now able to transform my app with Angular Animations. Thank You Maximilian Schwarzmüller
results.content_html:
I love my smartphone so i knew my apps where missing something.
I loved how each module of this course build up on each other. The examples are practical and The instructor is available to answer questions or help with problems that you might run into. THis course took me about a week and I was able to go from a basic app to adding parent child route transitions along with staggered lists into my app and understand things to watch out for. Super excited im now able to transform my app with Angular Animations. Thank You Maximilian Schwarzmüller

results.content: I changed my review to 5 stars because really enjoyed the course. It is explained clearly, with some exercises and nuances highlighted. Also comparative for the questions like which method is better. Exercises are good. I still think real world examples and decomposing a bit of those would also be nice but very good course. Already started using in real world app.
results.content_html: I changed my review to 5 stars because really enjoyed the course. It is explained clearly, with some exercises and nuances highlighted. results.content:
I had a great experience learning animations for angular. If you took the complete Angular class, there will be some overlapping content pertaining to the basic animations methods. However, this class does go beyond and offers more styling/animation methods to really spice up the user experience. Max does a great job thoroughly explaining his lectures as always. 

One thing holding back from 5 stars is that some content which was taught later became obsolete due to a better/updated method (i.e. stagger method, new routing animation method).
results.content_html:
I had a great experience learning animations for angular. If you took the complete Angular class, there will be some overlapping content pertaining to the basic animations methods. However, this class does go beyond and offers more styling/animation methods to really spice up the user experience. Max does a great job thoroughly explaining his lectures as always.

One thing holding back from 5 stars is that some content which was taught later became obsolete due to a better/updated method (i.e. stagger method, new routing animation method).

results.content:
Since we use CSS frameworks like Bootstrap, the course should include scenarios where ready to use Bootstrap classes get added / removed from components, etc.

In general more real world examples should be demonstrated, like a login page -> home page transition after successful login for example.
results.content_html:
Since we use CSS frameworks like Bootstrap, the course should include scenarios where ready to use Bootstrap classes get added / removed from components, etc.

In general more real world examples should be demonstrated, like a login page -> home page transition after successful login for example.

results.content:
I'm really happy I signed up for this course. It is short, but very focused on the features that Angular gives you to style and animate your application. Everything is also shown in a nice practical project and you can challenge yourself to try implementing things before Max shows you how. 

It's hard to come up with a negative, maybe some more cheat sheets would be nice, but then on the other hand, Max recommends excellent resources, so you don't really need that.

If you want to deepen your knowledge of Angular Animations, I definitely recommend this course.
results.content_html:

results.content:
About the Course:
Well thought out course that helps with practical application of angular animations. All of what you learn in this course will help you create your own animations library that can be applied to everyday applications.

About the Instructor:
(Maximilian) Max is very knowledgeable about content and shares it in a way that is easy to follow and very informative! He taught in a way that really made me excited to tackle the next animation/module and really apply the information to projects from work! Will be looking into the other courses he offers... 

Overall, an awesome course that really helps you take on the angular animation library!
results.content_html:

results.content: Another indispensable course from Max. He has the talent to take a learning curve, no matter how seemingly steep, and flatten out through a series of solid explanations and examples. This by itself would be enough to make (any of) his courses extremely good resources, but value-add to this his obvious enthusiasm and amicability and what you will arrive at is the tendency to jump on a course just because he is listed as the instructor.

results.content:
Max is always very detailed in his explanations.
Transition and animation of width and height is ok to understand the core angular animation concepts first.
I would want the course material to include more common animations which we see in day to day in many websites, so that with this one course we could kick start a working project with more practical angular animations. btw
I am yet to complete the course. Now @70.

results.content: This course is the first one i'm a bit disapointed with. I'm a big fan of Max's way of teaching, and academind is always my reference. But still, I felt like we never really used a lots a features. Of course, it's up to us now to go dive deeply into animations, and I am. But I don't know, I may have wanted something more complete and complex. Still, I keep this course, but it is only going to be a "fresh reminder" instead of a "bible" as the other courses Max provides on Udemy. And one last thing, I think this course should be updated a bit. Keep going the good work!
